repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Nvim-treesitter has switched to the upstream format, so no reason for keeping the deprecated legacy format around any longer.

comment_data.body: `lang` is now `string?`. Did you not get a warning?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -850,10 +791,6 @@ function LanguageTree:_get_injections()
       self._injection_query:iter_matches(root_node, self._source, start_line, end_line + 1)
     do
       local lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection(match, metadata)
-      if not lang then
-        -- TODO(lewis6991): remove after 0.9 (#20434)
-        lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection_deprecated(match, metadata)
-      end

comment_data.body:
I get warnings all the time; hard to see which ones are critical. I have to admit I didn't expect the deprecated fallback to be load bearing here...

So what's the correct fix? Bail if `lang` is `nil`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -850,10 +791,6 @@ function LanguageTree:_get_injections()
       self._injection_query:iter_matches(root_node, self._source, start_line, end_line + 1)
     do
       local lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection(match, metadata)
-      if not lang then
-        -- TODO(lewis6991): remove after 0.9 (#20434)
-        lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection_deprecated(match, metadata)
-      end

comment_data.body:
> I get warnings all the time; hard to see which ones are critical. 

This file should be almost clean with the project `.luarc.json`.

> I have to admit I didn't expect the deprecated fallback to be load bearing here...

Well only because the function will error if it doesn't resolve the match. So in practice it makes little difference, I'm just being strict.

> So what's the correct fix? Bail if lang is nil?

Just don't add the injection if `lang` is `nil`.

Extra points if you can log an error or warning.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -850,10 +791,6 @@ function LanguageTree:_get_injections()
       self._injection_query:iter_matches(root_node, self._source, start_line, end_line + 1)
     do
       local lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection(match, metadata)
-      if not lang then
-        -- TODO(lewis6991): remove after 0.9 (#20434)
-        lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection_deprecated(match, metadata)
-      end

comment_data.body:
> Just don't add the injection if lang is nil.

Already done.

> Extra points if you can log an error or warning.

How? `self._log`? What would you like to see? (Feel free to push to this PR if that's easier.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -850,10 +791,6 @@ function LanguageTree:_get_injections()
       self._injection_query:iter_matches(root_node, self._source, start_line, end_line + 1)
     do
       local lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection(match, metadata)
-      if not lang then
-        -- TODO(lewis6991): remove after 0.9 (#20434)
-        lang, combined, ranges = self:_get_injection_deprecated(match, metadata)
-      end

comment_data.body:
Yeah.

Just some audit that a match from an injection query failed.

Not super important, but I'm gradually putting this kind of messaging in.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_regular_data.body: Tests need a bit more work to fix up.

Still one failing test:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2ca076e45fb3f1c08f6a1a374834df0701b8d778/test/functional/treesitter/parser_spec.lua#L697-L713

(even with the updated `metadata` format). Is that directive approach no longer possible with upstream injections?

title: fix(treesitter)!: remove deprecated legacy injection format
